Reviews.Title: “Not the ritz but great location”
Reviews.Author: AndreaBoyd
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my school in October for a trip to Rome. The school had to book through school contacts so we where expecting the hotel to be a hostel for youths however this was not the situation. We arrived at Max Hotel, we where annoyed that the lift did not work and was quite smelly so we had to hike about 27 stairs with two suitcases each to get to the reception. Once we got to the reception we where grated with friendly, handsome Italian men what really could you want, the problem with the hotel was the breakfast the rooms where spotless as they where cleaned daily and bed sheets where cleaned daily but the breakfast provided in the morning was terrible, we would have went to the local shop next door to the hotel or across to a bakery to purchases buns or chocolate for breakfast. We never stayed in the hotel for dinner as it was not provided, the location of the hotel was fantastic 20min walk to the famous fountain, 5 minutes from a train station with lots of designer shops. If your in Rome to explore the city all day the Hotel Max is for you it's really a resting nest. Will be back again when come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BobbyatWells
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about this hotel having read previous reviews on TripAdvisor. However, I was pleasantly surprised by Hotel Max. Admittedly the common areas shared with other hotels were not the greatest, but the lift was in good working order and did not smell. The rooms provided were clean and of a good size - one point though - four bedded rooms are not suitable for adults - there should be no more than three to a room. The bathrooms were good and clean towels provided every day. Although the breakfasts were wholesome, they did become a little boring - I would have like a little more variety. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. If you are taking a group of undergraduates to Rome I would recommend Hotel Max.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible.”
Reviews.Author: 1Minerva
Reviews.Content: Not as bad as a lot of the other reviews state. Room sizes are small, our shower room was also small. There was a lot of traffic noise but that was to be expected as it was so close to the Termini. Good location, easy to walk to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain etc. Breakfast was not good, just a roll and jam, there are supermarkets just down the street though. Would reccomend for no frills, budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and condition for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mihaela_Manea
Reviews.Content: We visit Rome in the middle of February ( 4 people) and stayed 3 night at MAX Hotel. The Hotel is a small one, at the 3rd floor of a building with several hotels. The stairs and the elevator is not 100% clean but that didn't bother us that much. The location is perfect- near Termini Station and its easy to get anywhere :). The hotel room was perfectly clean so was the toilet. There was a TV, fridge and personal safe in every room so you can leave your valuables there. The towels were changed every day. The stuff was really nice to us. In the first day we arrived at the Hotel at 11:00 am and they give us our rooms (even though the check-in was at 1:00 pm ). Last day we had our plane at 10:00 pm and they let us live our luggage there all day long. There is a bag thing though: the coffee at the Hotel is really bad. :) PS: the hotel is not hard to find if you send 10 minutes on the internet before the trip to search for the location.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience in my life”
Reviews.Author: gantzer89
Reviews.Content: It was almost impossible to find the place. The stairs and the elevator were very dirty. The halls of the hotel smelled very bad because the staff bathroom was open and so near to our room. We booked one room for four persons and the just but four beds one really close to the other, I think it was a room for two adapted for four. I strongly discourage to don't book this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Hotel could be better, but it was okay...”
Reviews.Author: PsychoFairy
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay in Hotel Siracusa, but it seems they didn't want a large group (41 persons) there, so a few hours before we left to Rome we heard to hotel changed to Hotel Max... Anyway, we left and we were going to try to make the best of it since we didn't knew where we were going to end up, because we didn't had the chance to google the hotel anymore before leaving... When we arrived there, we noticed that there where 6 hotels in one building. We had to climb to the 3rd floor, where the reception of Max is situated. The which we had to pass every day was disgusting. It was dusty, with cigarettes all over the floor. We really didn't trust the elevator... That says enough... The organisation was a mess! It felt like they weren't prepared for a large group like us! When the chaos was over, we finally had to chance to go to our room. The first thing we couldn't ignore was the terrible smell coming out of our room when we first opened the door. We immediately opened the window and when we came back to the hotel later that evening, the smell was almost gone. For some reason the cleaning lady closed the window every single day when we were out of the hotel, so the room was smelly again.. The room was also very tiny, and there wasn't enough space for 3 people to put their luggage. Breakfast was really poor, we all got 1 piece of bread and you could only choose between nutella, honey and jam. The first day i tried to drink cappuccino but it tasted like it was made from water from the dishes... Hot chocolate, which i tried the day after, was okay. When we were still hungry, we went to 'DESPAR', a supermarket, to buy some cookies/chips/... Now let's be positive: The location is great!!! The Central station (Termini) is just 2 minutes away, so you can easily take the train or underground to anywhere! Our bathroom's size was big when you compare it to the size of the bedroom. There were also fresh towels every day! That was really pleasant! The staff was okay, but they were having discussions all the time with eachother... (Or anyway it seems like they were...) Generally, our stay was okay, but it wasn't the best hotel i've ever stayed in... For a study group, it you don't ask for a lot of luxury, it's not that bad..

Reviews.Title: “overcrowded and an insult to our intelligence”
Reviews.Author: Freck1e
Reviews.Content: Room 2 - Situated on 5th floor. (The hotel lobby is on the 3rd floor as the other floors are occupied by different hotels) I arrived with a party of Photography students on a field trip to Rome. The booking in procedure seemed to take hours and upon finally getting to our room it was 4 beds all jammed together with less than a foot of room between the bed and the opposite wall. Four girls had to get ready in this! The bathroom appeared to be of mediocre standard until I tried the shower (there was no bath). The water was cold and the shower head had not been cleaned in years and had clogged up so much that the water was not coming out properly. The second morning I tried the shower again, and there was warm water but after being in there for less than a minute the shower door fell on me - the entire door! Shortly after my friend climbed on her bed to get ready (there was no floorspace to walk on) and the bed collapsed! It was like a scene out of Faulty towers! Luckily, as Rome had so much to offer, we spent most of the day and night site seeing and just used the hotel as somewhere to crash.. The lift was good when it was working but was a bit hit and miss so wouldnt recommend this hotel if you cant climb 15 flights of stairs. Oh, and breakfasdt - dont believe what they tell you, even the receptionist warned us how bad it was, and he was right - after morning 1, we are at the eatery accross the road.

Reviews.Title: “I really didn't like it! It was crap!”
Reviews.Author: meavis
Reviews.Content: It was terrible! The rooms were really really small!! The I shared my bedroom with two other people and our beds had to be pushed together into one big bed to fit them into the tiny rooms! The shower was tiny and bearly worked! I was really disapointed with the Hotel! The Lift didnt work half the time and the roof of the lift was covered in fag butts and a used condom!!!! I would not go back!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: aoifedoogan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. There was 6 hotels in one building. Hotel max was on the 3rd floor and 5th floor. The elevator didn't work properly, there was cigarette butts on top of the elevator. It was disgusting. The hotel was health hazzard. The electricity on the 5th floor went off on the first night and there was no lights on the stairs, some students fell. The elevator also broke down and some of our classmates were in it. The rooms were awful, they were extremely cramped, there was no space to layout a suitcase. There was no air conditioning and the windows would not open. There was no fire escapes. The dining room was TINY, there was 34 of us on the tour and only about 10 of us could fit into the dining room. The tvs in the hotels did not work. The bathrooms were okay. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Colosseu
Reviews.Content: Max hotel is a very very small but pleasant hotel located very central and only 2 minutes walk from the Termini Station. I especially liked that the hotel was so close to Termini, and by the way only 5 min walk to Santa Maria Maggiore Church. I went there with my siblings, and it is very ideal for family vacation with older children, I wouldn't recommend this hotel for couples with small children because of the room sizes. The rooms are small but it was ok considering the low price you pay for this hotel. The staff is nice except one lady in the reception - she was constantly angry! Theres a lot of voices and noises outside the window, so be prepared for sleepless nights:) no, i'm just kidding. We had some problems with the room facilities; the wall sockets! There was 3 in our room but only 1 was working. So bring an extra portable socket with ya or something like that:) And the hairdryer in the bathroom is very poor, so make sure to bring a hairdryer with you. The minibar looks like its broken and not freezing but it is actually working. The elevator is very old-fashioned but working aswell:) Breakfast at the hotel is fair enough, not much luxury; bread, butter, jam, nutella and honey. that is what you get every single day! We had a pleasant and funny time at max Hotel in Rome, and if you want a hotel situated next to everything(center) to a low price then choose Max Hotel, it is really worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for location”
Reviews.Author: m_difruscia
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I had a late arrival in Rome and early departure the next morning for Florence. We just needed a place to touch down for one night. That being said, Hotel Max is a great value for its location. Just about 1 block from Termini (train) station, right in the middle of Rome. The service and staff are great and extremely friendly. Some other reviewers have complained about the noise, but then again consider you are right in the middle of Rome. It’s not any noisier than any other downtown hotel and again I reiterate great value. The room size was adequate and very clean. Décor was a little dated. The room was equipped with air conditioning but it was either broken or I didn’t know how to use it. Regardless, for one night I let it be. I would not recommend this hotel for a long-term stay or if you plan to be in your room for most of your stay. But it is great place and fantastic value if you plan to touch down for a few nights and explore one of the world’s greatest cities. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smugglerxx
Reviews.Content: Las week, me and my girlfriend spent three nights at Hotel Max in Rome. We were a little bit worried when we booked the hotel but we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is literally a few steps form Termini station which saved us money for local transport. The distance from the city centre is also very comfortable (about 15 minutes walk from Coloseum). We used the public transport just once when going to Vatikan. The hotel room was perfectly clean so was the toilet. There is a TV, fridge and personal safe in every room so you can leave your valuables there. Some staff don’t speak much English but are nice . The cold breakfast in included (bread, jam, chocolate spread, juice, hot bev.) We can only recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CanberraLeonie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Max Hotel for 3 nights . Location was fantastic a 2-3 min walk to the Termini Station and there was a Train directly to and from airport for $11 each way so you dont have to use the metro.. 10 min walk to the Collosuem which was fantatstic. Also the hop on and off buses are a treat especially if you wanting to see all the popular sites in a short amount of time. Staff were great, very helpful and the Maria in the Breakfast room was so helpful and attentative, breakfast consisted of a Bread Roll and Coffee but was enough for us.. Rooms are very clean and bed was comfortable , great safe in the room also.. Great Value for the price that is for sure.. Would recommend and stay there again

HotelInfo.Name: Max Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gioberti 30, 00185 Rome, Italy
